name: NSPageControllerDelegate
desc: The NSPageControllerDelegate protocol allows you to customize the behavior of instances of the NSPageController class.

items.name: func pageControllerWillStartLiveTransition(NSPageController)
items.desc: This message is sent when the user begins a transition.

items.name: func pageControllerDidEndLiveTransition(NSPageController)
items.desc: This message is sent when a transition animation completes.

items.name: func pageController(NSPageController, didTransitionTo: Any)
items.desc: This message is sent when any page transition is completed.

items.name: func pageController(NSPageController, identifierFor: Any) -> NSPageController.ObjectIdentifier
items.desc: Return the identifier of the view controller that owns a view to display the object.

items.name: func pageController(NSPageController, viewControllerForIdentifier: NSPageController.ObjectIdentifier) -> NSViewController
items.desc: Returns a view controller the page controller uses for managing the specified identifier.

items.name: func pageController(NSPageController, prepare: NSViewController, with: Any?)
items.desc: Prepare the view controller and itâ€™s view for drawing.

items.name: func pageController(NSPageController, frameFor: Any?) -> NSRect
items.desc: Returns the frame appropriate for displaying the specified object.
